info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 08 at 3:48PM EST until January 10 at 9:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg SC has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in North Carolina... Broad River In NC At Boiling Springs affecting Cleveland County. .A potent storm system is expected to produce 3.5-4.5 inches of rainfall across the upper Broad River watershed from Tuesday morning through Tuesday evening. This rainfall will quickly overwhelm saturated soils and result in excessive runoff and significant stream rises across Rutherford and Cleveland Counties, with some small tributaries of the Broad River possibly exceeding bankfull and causing nuisance to Minor flooding of adjacent areas as early as late Tuesday morning. This excessive flow will cause the Broad River from downstream of Cliffside to the Broad River Greenway to Gaston Shoals to exceed Action/Advisory Stage Tuesday afternoon and Minor Flood Stage Wednesday morning. This will result in common, deeper flooding of low-lying areas adjacent to the Broad River with lesser impacts to vulnerable property. Residents are advised to move vulnerable property to higher ground and stay up-to-date by monitoring the latest river levels and forecasts. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY EVENING TO LATE WEDNESDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Broad River In NC at Boiling Springs. * WHEN...From Tuesday evening to late Wednesday evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Broad River floodwaters may be impacting residential yards and approaching crawlspaces and basements of homes between Abe`s Mountain Rd. and the river. The Broad River is likely flooding boat-access areas and the lowest elevations of Broad River Greenway with at least 1-2 feet of floodwaters. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 2.9 feet and falling steadily. - Action/Advisory Stage is 12.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above Minor Flood Stage Wednesday morning and reach a crest of 12.1 feet Wednesday morning. It will then fall below Minor Flood Stage later Wednesday morning. - Minor Flood Stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Even 6 inches of fast-moving flood water can knock you off your feet and a depth of 2 feet will float your car. Never try to walk, swim, or drive through such swift water. If you come upon flood waters, stop, turn around and go another way. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. For detailed information including observed and forecast stages, flood impacts, flood history, FEMA Flood Hazard Layers, and more, please visit: https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp The next statement will be issued before Wednesday evening at 900 PM EST.
